qas.question: How old can my covid test be when entering congo?
Who is exempt from needing to provide a test when entering the congo?
What happens if i do not provide a test upon entry in congo?

answers.text: test at the airport, and need to self-isolate for 14 days

paragraphs.context: All passengers arriving in the Republic of Congo by commercial flights should provide proof of a negative coronavirus (COVID-19) test undertaken within 72 hours upon entry, with the exception of children under 11 years of age. Passengers who do not present a negative COVID-19 test upon entry will undertake a COVID-19 test at the airport, and need to self-isolate for 14 days, pending the results. Screening on arrival: Travellers entering the Republic of Congo may be subject to screening, including temperature checks. Data collection: There are currently no track and trace requirements for arrivals.
